resources.string: "Apps won't be able to access any ID unless you explicitly allow them to do that. Some personal recommendation features might not work properly when this feature is on."

"About this feature 1. Run this feature once or twice if you find that your speaker is lightly blocked by dust. 2. If the speaker is blocked heavily, run this feature 2-5 times while shaking your device with the speaker facing downwards."
Play a 30-second audio to clear the speaker
All backups stored on this device will be deleted permanently. Back up important items to your computer and Xiaomi Cloud before you continue.
Back up and restore items using a computer
Adjust colors and lower contrast automatically when brightness is reduced
Instead of your real identifier, MIUI will provide a virtual ID (OAID) to third party apps. It prevents apps from tracking your behavior and preferences, and protects your privacy.
Update backups before performing the factory reset?
"Clearing takes 30 seconds. Don't leave this page. Maximize sound volume for best effect."
Face data can be used to unlock your device or verify your identity. Add Lock screen password before adding your face data.
"You won't be able to unlock device using your face data after you delete it."
After the screen lights up, swipe up to unlock the device using face data.
Unlock device using your face data
Replace slider shortcuts with face unlock
Security issues: Face unlock is less secure than a PIN, password, or pattern. Your device might be unlocked with your photo, as well as by people or objects with similar appearance.
"Make sure all parts of your face aren't covered by objects and are clearly visible. Your face should be well-lit as well."
Hold the device in front of your face
You can unlock the device using face data whenever the screen lights up for incoming notifications. This may drain the battery faster.
Allow Face unlock when screen lights up
Open your eyes a bit wider
Turn your head to the right
Turn your head to the left
Push the screen down to open camera
Stay 25 to 40cm away from the screen
Allow Lock screen notifications to be able to view them on your Lock screen.
Show only notification source when device is locked and add notification details after face data is verified
Show notification details after verifying face data
Notifications will be shown on Lock screen
Stay on the Lock screen after your face is verified. Swipe up to open the Home screen.
Stay on Lock screen after unlocking
Use a USB drive to back up or restore items
Press and hold, and then pull down the action bar of a floating window
Viewing floating windows in fullscreen mode
Press and hold the action bar of a floating window to drag
Drag the floating window to the corner of the screen
Press and hold, and then pull down the action bar of a notification
Swipe up from the action bar of a floating window
"·Press and hold, and then pull down a notification to open it in a floating window. ·Tap \"Floating windows\" in Recents to select apps."
Multiple satellite navigation systems (%s) are supported
Sync the list of apps, back up system settings and Home screen layout
"You can unlock this device using your face data now. Continue to access additional settings."
"Couldn't add face data. Wait a minute or two and try again."
"Can't add data for more than 2 faces"
Tap \"Restore"\" to fix the issues that prevent you from using NFC features. Don't leave the current page while NFC functionality is being restored. Reboot your device to apply changes."
"Have you experienced any of these issues? %d. You couldn't add or top up an NFC card. %d. Your NFC card didn't work. %d. Other NFC features won't load."
An error occurred that prevented NFC functionality from being restored. Try again.
Reboot your device to apply changes.
Fix the issues that prevent you from using NFC features
Back up and restore items on this device
Some apps might be displayed incorrectly in Dark mode. You can restrict using Dark mode for individual apps here.

"To call your emergency contacts and play SOS recording, this app needs the following permissions: • Making calls For making calls to your emergency contacts • Monitoring device status For playing SOS recording when your emergency contacts pick up If you don't agree to grant such permissions, you won't be able to use some features of this app; however, its basic functionality will still be available to you. You can always choose to turn this feature off."

"This app needs permission to access your call history to be able to share it with your emergency contacts. If you don't agree to grant such permissions, you won't be able to use some features of this app; however, its basic functionality will still be available to you. You can always choose to turn this feature off."

"Emergency SOS allows you to share your location in real time and send text messages to your emergency contacts. We shall protect your personal information in accordance with the relevant laws, regulations, and privacy policies. Note that this app needs to connect to the internet and requires the following permissions to collect your personal information: • Accessing storage For saving emergency contacts • Accessing contacts For marking contacts as emergency contacts • Sending SMS For sending text messages to emergency contacts • Accessing location For sharing your location with emergency contacts If you don't agree to grant such permissions or share and upload your personal information, you won't be able to use this app. You can choose to turn off or not use Emergency SOS in such cases. Before using our services, read and agree to our %s."
Bring the phone a bit farther away from your face
"Can't see some parts of your face"
Keep your face inside the frame
Turn your head to the left
Turn your head to the right
3D face data allows to unlock your device and verify your identity. You must set a password before using this feature.

"Make sure all parts of your face are clearly visible. Don't wear hats, sunglasses, or other accessories that might cover your face while recording 3D face data. Make sure your face is evenly lit as well."
Note: Using 3D face data is slightly less secure than using a password. People or objects that look a lot like you might be able to unlock your device.
"Couldn't launch Camera and get preview. Try again."
"A hardware error occurred. Reboot your device. If this doesn't help, call 400–100–5678 to get help."
"Can't record face data due to an optical module error. Reboot your device and try again."
"3D recognition will be turned off. Your 3D face data will be deleted. You'll also have to add your 2D face data. Turn on 2D recognition?"
"2D recognition will be turned off. Your 2D face data will be deleted. You'll also have to add your 3D face data. Turn on 3D recognition?"
2D face recognition is less secure than a pattern, PIN, or password. When this feature is on, your device might be unlocked by your photo, as well as people or objects that look like you.

"3D face recognition is relatively secure. It's highly unlikely that your device can be unlocked with your photo when this feature is on. However, it might be unlocked by people or objects that look like you."
"You have to complete all the steps yourself. Don't switch places with anyone."
"Couldn't add face data. Move farther away from the screen."
